experience: I began learning the fundamentals of programming, which inspired me to pursue a technical career in mechatronics during high school.

During my technical studies, I began learning C and C++ to develop simple console applications and Arduino programs. I used these skills to solve mathematical problems, create control systems, and program basic robots. This experience ultimately led me to pursue a degree in computer systems.

At the start of my university studies, I learned the fundamentals of web development using languages like Java and JavaScript, along with essential web design technologies such as HTML and CSS. I created prototypes for both academic assignments and personal projects during my early years.

One of my projects, Ponymaps, caught the attention of my professors, who encouraged me to enhance it further. I subsequently nominated it for various exhibitions and competitions, and it won several awards. Due to its success, the institution's authorities requested that I complete the project and integrate it into the school's ecosystem.

Thanks to my professor's recommendations, I was offered an internship at Gaytan Studio. During the 5 month internship, I contributed to the design and development of a ticket management system, working with Django for the backend and React for the frontend.

Eager to learn cloud computing, I accepted an internship offer from a Spanish company called Alebat Education. There, I worked as an AWS developer, collaborating as part of the DevOps team. I worked in a multi-account landing zone and set up various AWS services, including pipelines, alarms, Lambda functions, and containers.

I received my degree in software engineering at the age of 22. I gained invaluable experience through the many side projects and internships that I took, which allowed me to explore multiple fields such as mobile development, artificial intelligence, cloud computing and a strong expertise in web development, thanks to hands-on experience.

I began working at the General Prosecutor's Office of the State of Michoac√°n as a Full Stack Developer. There I developed a ticketing system for managing complaints and joined the development team for the institution's new main administration system, the largest project I have worked on to date.
